thread.title: White House updates travel rules for green card holders
thread.title_full: White House updates travel rules for green card holders

author: cbc
title: White House updates travel rules for green card holders
text:
The White House said on Wednesday it has issued updated guidance on President Donald Trump's executive order on immigration clarifying that legal permanent residents, or green card holders, do not require a waiver to enter the United States.
"They no longer need a waiver because if they are a legal permanent resident they won't need it anymore," White House spokesman Sean Spicer said at a news briefing.
White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer issued an update Wednesday on the Trump administration's controversial new immigration policy, saying it won't apply to permanent residents. (Susan Walsh/The Associated Press)
The restriction on green card holders was among the most confusing element in the executive order signed on Friday.
The new interpretation on rules for green card holders was also discussed by Department of Homeland Security officials at a briefing on Tuesday.
